Who would have thought 15 years ago, a group of people, dedicated to 
bringing eclectic live music, an array of artists and like-minded people
together would have come so far? From 700 people gathering in the Black
Mountains in 1994 to 30,000 people gathering among the fields of Eastnor
Castle Deer Park in 2008, The Big Chill Festival has always been about
getting motivated by good music, animated about the arts and passionate
about putting on a party.

So how to celebrate such a milestone? Well you get together all the
tastemaking DJs, influential artists and the visual visionaries who make
the Big Chill experience what it is, and you get them to pick one tune
that sums up what the Big Chill festival means to them. Then you put all
those tunes of one album and sell it for charity. SoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦ weÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re doing that.

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“15 By 15' is a compilation album with, as the name suggests, 15 luminaries
of the world that is Big Chill, choosing 15 different tracks to celebrate
the festivalÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s 15th year of existence. The selectors include Mr Norman
Jay MBE, Gilles Peterson, Tom Middleton, Mr Scruff, Coldcut, Tuung, Jon 
Hopkins and the Big Chill Forum dwellers to name a few. With such choice
cuts including tracks from Orbital, The Cinematic Orchestra, 4 Hero,
The Orb, Ulrich Schnauss and Jon Shuttleworth, not to mention an exclusive
composition from Tom Middleton himself featuring on the iTunes edition of
the album. ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“15 By 15' is going to be a souvenir to some, on constant repeat
for others and one brilliant compilation for all!

The album will be released in early March with full details of all the
selectors and the tracks selected being published on www.bigchill.net soon.

All the profits from the sale of the album will go to The Big Issue, a
close working relationship that continues to bloom between the two 'bigs'
with successful initiative after initiative helping the vendors and the
festival alike.
